summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys to Judge Alison J. Nathan, responding to a court order regarding proposed limiting instructions for her upcoming trial. The defense states they have no edits to the proposed instructions but request an opportunity to respond to the government's submission.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, who is the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom this letter is addressed.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case in which Maxwell is the defendant.

events.title: Court Order Regarding Limiting Instructions
events.description: The court issued an order requesting that parties submit suggested edits to proposed limiting instructions for the upcoming trial.

events.title: Final Pretrial Conference
events.description: Scheduled final pretrial conference in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, Cohen & Gresser LLP, submitted this letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The defense stated they had no edits to the court's proposed limiting instructions for the trial.
The defense requested an opportunity to respond to the government's lengthy submission, either in writing or at the final pretrial conference.
The document indicates ongoing pretrial proceedings in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330).
